abstract: The Dow industrials closed up more than 400 points, but there was little relief from the paralysis that has gripped the credit markets.
snippet: The Dow industrials closed up more than 400 points, but there was little relief from the paralysis that has gripped the credit markets.
lead_paragraph: A seesaw day on Wall Street ended with a rush of euphoria Thursday as investors raced back into beaten-down banking shares, heartened by signs that the government is taking more drastic steps to tamp down problems plaguing the financial markets.

headline.main: Investors, Hungry for Hope, Send Dow Up 410
headline.print_headline: Investors, Hungry for Hope, Send Dow Up 410

byline.original: By Vikas Bajaj and Michael M. Grynbaum

abstract: The Federal Reserve and other central banks significantly escalated aid to improve liquidity.
snippet: The Federal Reserve and other central banks significantly escalated aid to improve liquidity.
lead_paragraph: Reflecting concerns about the health of the global financial system, the Federal Reserve and the world’s other major central banks significantly escalated their assistance to global markets on Thursday, making almost $200 billion available after bank lending came to a near halt and threatened the global economy.

headline.main: Fed Offers $180 Billion for Ailing Money Markets
headline.print_headline: Central Banks Unite to Aid Global Money Markets

byline.original: By Matthew Saltmarsh and Keith Bradsher
